critique: The document outlines the delegation of functions and specification of laws related to the Taiwan Relations Act. It aims to maintain commercial, cultural, and other relations between the people of the United States and the people on Taiwan, following the recognition of the People's Republic of China. The document delegates presidential functions to the Secretary of State and the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, while reserving certain functions to the President. It specifies laws that can be bypassed for procurement of services by the American Institute on Taiwan and addresses amendments and modifications of contracts with the Institute. It also determines the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office in the United States (TECRO) as the instrumentality authorized to act on behalf of Taiwan. The document continues agreements and arrangements from President Carter's memorandum of December 30, 1978, and supersedes Executive Order No. 12143 of June 22, 1979.
